<Link id="l00008" /><CodeLine lineNumber="8"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00009" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This file implements the guard widening pass.  The semantics of the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00010" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// @llvm.experimental.guard intrinsic lets LLVM transform it so that it fails</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00011" /><CodeLine lineNumber="11"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// more often that it did before the transform.  This optimization is called</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00012" /><CodeLine lineNumber="12"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// &quot;widening&quot; and can be used hoist and common runtime checks in situations like</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00013" /><CodeLine lineNumber="13"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// these:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00014" /><CodeLine lineNumber="14"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00015" /><CodeLine lineNumber="15"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    %cmp0 = 7 u&lt; Length</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00016" /><CodeLine lineNumber="16"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    call @llvm.experimental.guard(i1 %cmp0) &#91; &quot;deopt&quot;(...) &#93;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00017" /><CodeLine lineNumber="17"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    call @unknown&#95;side&#95;effects()</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00018" /><CodeLine lineNumber="18"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    %cmp1 = 9 u&lt; Length</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00019" /><CodeLine lineNumber="19"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    call @llvm.experimental.guard(i1 %cmp1) &#91; &quot;deopt&quot;(...) &#93;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00020" /><CodeLine lineNumber="20"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    ...</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00021" /><CodeLine lineNumber="21"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00022" /><CodeLine lineNumber="22"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// =&gt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00023" /><CodeLine lineNumber="23"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00024" /><CodeLine lineNumber="24"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    %cmp0 = 9 u&lt; Length</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="25"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    call @llvm.experimental.guard(i1 %cmp0) &#91; &quot;deopt&quot;(...) &#93;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="26"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    call @unknown&#95;side&#95;effects()</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    ...</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If %cmp0 is false, @llvm.experimental.guard will &quot;deoptimize&quot; back to a</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// generic implementation of the same function, which will have the correct</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// semantics from that point onward.  It is always &#95;legal&#95; to deoptimize (so</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// replacing %cmp0 with false is &quot;correct&quot;), though it may not always be</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// profitable to do so.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// NB! This pass is a work in progress.  It hasn&#39;t been tuned to be &quot;production</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// ready&quot; yet.  It is known to have quadriatic running time and will not scale</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// to large numbers of guards</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="114"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="115"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Find a point at which the widened condition of \\p Guard should be inserted.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="116"><Highlight kind="comment">/// When it is represented as intrinsic call, we can do it right before the call</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="117"><Highlight kind="comment">/// instruction. However, when we are dealing with widenable branch, we must</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="118"><Highlight kind="comment">/// account for the following situation: widening should not turn a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="119"><Highlight kind="comment">/// loop-invariant condition into a loop-variant. It means that if</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="120"><Highlight kind="comment">/// widenable.condition() call is invariant (w.r.t. any loop), the new wide</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="121"><Highlight kind="comment">/// condition should stay invariant. Otherwise there can be a miscompile, like</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="122"><Highlight kind="comment">/// the one described at https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/issues/60234. The</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="123"><Highlight kind="comment">/// safest way to do it is to expand the new condition at WC&#39;s block.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="124"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> std::optional&lt;BasicBlock::iterator&gt;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="125" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-guardwidening-cpp-/#a0d69c80bfa592d9ac6901fa22f7ff405"><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-guardwidening-cpp-/#a0d69c80bfa592d9ac6901fa22f7ff405">findInsertionPointForWideCondition</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42;WCOrGuard) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="126"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a656efdcee3deb029763304d3e741a2d1">isGuard</a>(WCOrGuard))</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="127"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> WCOrGuard-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/ilist-node-impl/#af719fc783be6589465137d997701a432">getIterator</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00141" /><CodeLine lineNumber="141"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// the blocks within a function, or only a given loop&#39;s blocks and preheader.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00152" /><CodeLine lineNumber="152"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00153" /><CodeLine lineNumber="153"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Try to eliminate instruction \\p Instr by widening it into an earlier</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00154" /><CodeLine lineNumber="154"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// dominating guard.  \\p DFSI is the DFS iterator on the dominator tree that</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00155" /><CodeLine lineNumber="155"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// is currently visiting the block containing \\p Guard, and \\p GuardsPerBlock</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00156" /><CodeLine lineNumber="156"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// maps BasicBlocks to the set of guards seen in that block.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00157" /><CodeLine lineNumber="157"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> eliminateInstrViaWidening(</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00158" /><CodeLine lineNumber="158"><Highlight kind="normal">      <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42;Instr, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/df-iterator">df&#95;iterator&lt;DomTreeNode &#42;&gt;</a> &amp;DFSI,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00159" /><CodeLine lineNumber="159"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/densemap">DenseMap</a>&lt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> &#42;, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvector">SmallVector&lt;Instruction &#42;, 8&gt;</a>&gt;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00160" /><CodeLine lineNumber="160"><Highlight kind="normal">          &amp;GuardsPerBlock);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00161" /><CodeLine lineNumber="161"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00162" /><CodeLine lineNumber="162"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Used to keep track of which widening potential is more effective.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00163" /><CodeLine lineNumber="163"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">enum</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> WideningScore &#123;</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00164" /><CodeLine lineNumber="164"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// Don&#39;t widen.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00165" /><CodeLine lineNumber="165"><Highlight kind="normal">    WS&#95;IllegalOrNegative,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00166" /><CodeLine lineNumber="166"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00167" /><CodeLine lineNumber="167"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// Widening is performance neutral as far as the cycles spent in check</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00168" /><CodeLine lineNumber="168"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// conditions goes (but can still help, e.g., code layout, having less</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00169" /><CodeLine lineNumber="169"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// deopt state).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00170" /><CodeLine lineNumber="170"><Highlight kind="normal">    WS&#95;Neutral,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00171" /><CodeLine lineNumber="171"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00172" /><CodeLine lineNumber="172"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// Widening is profitable.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00173" /><CodeLine lineNumber="173"><Highlight kind="normal">    WS&#95;Positive,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00174" /><CodeLine lineNumber="174"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00175" /><CodeLine lineNumber="175"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// Widening is very profitable.  Not significantly different from \\c</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00176" /><CodeLine lineNumber="176"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// WS&#95;Positive, except by the order.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00177" /><CodeLine lineNumber="177"><Highlight kind="normal">    WS&#95;VeryPositive</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00178" /><CodeLine lineNumber="178"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00179" /><CodeLine lineNumber="179"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00180" /><CodeLine lineNumber="180"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> scoreTypeToString(WideningScore WS);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00181" /><CodeLine lineNumber="181"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00182" /><CodeLine lineNumber="182"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Compute the score for widening the condition in \\p DominatedInstr</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00382" /><CodeLine lineNumber="382"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Ignore trivial true or false conditions. These instructions will be</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00391" /><CodeLine lineNumber="391"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00392" /><CodeLine lineNumber="392"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// In the set of dominating guards, find the one we can merge GuardInst with</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00511" /><CodeLine lineNumber="511"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// For constant conditions, only one dynamical successor is possible</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00512" /><CodeLine lineNumber="512"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;ConstCond = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a22eeee01734061ac1b31ccd994c49eef">dyn&#95;cast&lt;ConstantInt&gt;</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/riscv/riscvredundantcopyelimination-cpp/#a193847098793cdbab306803186676899">Cond</a>))</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00515" /><CodeLine lineNumber="515"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (IfFalse-&gt;getPostdominatingDeoptimizeCall())</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00518" /><CodeLine lineNumber="518"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> IfFalse;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00519" /><CodeLine lineNumber="519"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// TODO: Use branch frequency metatada to allow hoisting through non-deopt</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00520" /><CodeLine lineNumber="520"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// branches?</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00521" /><CodeLine lineNumber="521"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">nullptr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00522" /><CodeLine lineNumber="522"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00523" /><CodeLine lineNumber="523"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00524" /><CodeLine lineNumber="524"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Returns true if we might be hoisting above explicit control flow into a</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00525" /><CodeLine lineNumber="525"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// considerably hotter block.  Note that this completely ignores implicit</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00526" /><CodeLine lineNumber="526"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// control flow (guards, calls which throw, etc...).  That choice appears</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00527" /><CodeLine lineNumber="527"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// arbitrary (we assume that implicit control flow exits are all rare).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00528" /><CodeLine lineNumber="528"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> MaybeHoistingToHotterBlock = &#91;&amp;&#93;() &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00529" /><CodeLine lineNumber="529"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;DominatingBlock = WideningPoint-&gt;getParent();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00530" /><CodeLine lineNumber="530"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;DominatedBlock = DominatedInstr-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/ilist-detail/node-parent-access/#a7e19e7508415378ad9523e0339b23e22">getParent</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00531" /><CodeLine lineNumber="531"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00532" /><CodeLine lineNumber="532"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Descend as low as we can, always taking the likely successor.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00533" /><CodeLine lineNumber="533"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(DT.isReachableFromEntry(DominatingBlock) &amp;&amp; </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;Unreached code&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00538" /><CodeLine lineNumber="538"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// No likely successor?</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00539" /><CodeLine lineNumber="539"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (!LikelySucc)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00540" /><CodeLine lineNumber="540"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">break</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00541" /><CodeLine lineNumber="541"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Only go down the dominator tree.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00542" /><CodeLine lineNumber="542"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (!DT.properlyDominates(DominatingBlock, LikelySucc))</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00543" /><CodeLine lineNumber="543"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">break</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00544" /><CodeLine lineNumber="544"><Highlight kind="normal">      DominatingBlock = LikelySucc;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00545" /><CodeLine lineNumber="545"><Highlight kind="normal">    &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00546" /><CodeLine lineNumber="546"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00547" /><CodeLine lineNumber="547"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Found?</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00548" /><CodeLine lineNumber="548"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (DominatedBlock == DominatingBlock)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00549" /><CodeLine lineNumber="549"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00550" /><CodeLine lineNumber="550"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We followed the likely successor chain and went past the dominated</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00551" /><CodeLine lineNumber="551"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// block. It means that the dominated guard is in dead/very cold code.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00554" /><CodeLine lineNumber="554"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// TODO: diamond, triangle cases</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00919" /><CodeLine lineNumber="919"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We have a series of f+1 checks as:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00920" /><CodeLine lineNumber="920"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00921" /><CodeLine lineNumber="921"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   I+k&#95;0 u&lt; L   ... Chk&#95;0</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00922" /><CodeLine lineNumber="922"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   I+k&#95;1 u&lt; L   ... Chk&#95;1</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00923" /><CodeLine lineNumber="923"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   ...</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00924" /><CodeLine lineNumber="924"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   I+k&#95;f u&lt; L   ... Chk&#95;f</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00925" /><CodeLine lineNumber="925"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00926" /><CodeLine lineNumber="926"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     with forall i in &#91;0,f&#93;: k&#95;f-k&#95;i u&lt; k&#95;f-k&#95;0  ... Precond&#95;0</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00927" /><CodeLine lineNumber="927"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//          k&#95;f-k&#95;0 u&lt; INT&#95;MIN+k&#95;f                 ... Precond&#95;1</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00928" /><CodeLine lineNumber="928"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//          k&#95;f != k&#95;0                             ... Precond&#95;2</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00929" /><CodeLine lineNumber="929"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00930" /><CodeLine lineNumber="930"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Claim:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00931" /><CodeLine lineNumber="931"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   Chk&#95;0 AND Chk&#95;f  implies all the other checks</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00932" /><CodeLine lineNumber="932"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00933" /><CodeLine lineNumber="933"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Informal proof sketch:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00934" /><CodeLine lineNumber="934"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00935" /><CodeLine lineNumber="935"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We will show that the integer range &#91;I+k&#95;0,I+k&#95;f&#93; does not unsigned-wrap</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00936" /><CodeLine lineNumber="936"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// (i.e. going from I+k&#95;0 to I+k&#95;f does not cross the -1,0 boundary) and</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00937" /><CodeLine lineNumber="937"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// thus I+k&#95;f is the greatest unsigned value in that range.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00938" /><CodeLine lineNumber="938"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00939" /><CodeLine lineNumber="939"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This combined with Ckh&#95;(f+1) shows that everything in that range is u&lt; L.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00940" /><CodeLine lineNumber="940"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Via Precond&#95;0 we know that all of the indices in Chk&#95;0 through Chk&#95;(f+1)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00941" /><CodeLine lineNumber="941"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// lie in &#91;I+k&#95;0,I+k&#95;f&#93;, this proving our claim.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00942" /><CodeLine lineNumber="942"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00943" /><CodeLine lineNumber="943"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// To see that &#91;I+k&#95;0,I+k&#95;f&#93; is not a wrapping range, note that there are</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00944" /><CodeLine lineNumber="944"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// two possibilities: I+k&#95;0 u&lt; I+k&#95;f or I+k&#95;0 &gt;u I+k&#95;f (they can&#39;t be equal</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00945" /><CodeLine lineNumber="945"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// since k&#95;0 != k&#95;f).  In the former case, &#91;I+k&#95;0,I+k&#95;f&#93; is not a wrapping</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00946" /><CodeLine lineNumber="946"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// range by definition, and the latter case is impossible:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00947" /><CodeLine lineNumber="947"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00948" /><CodeLine lineNumber="948"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   0-----I+k&#95;f---I+k&#95;0----L---INT&#95;MAX,INT&#95;MIN------------------(-1)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00949" /><CodeLine lineNumber="949"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   xxxxxx             xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00950" /><CodeLine lineNumber="950"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00951" /><CodeLine lineNumber="951"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// For Chk&#95;0 to succeed, we&#39;d have to have k&#95;f-k&#95;0 (the range highlighted</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00952" /><CodeLine lineNumber="952"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// with &#39;x&#39; above) to be at least &gt;u INT&#95;MIN.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00953" /><CodeLine lineNumber="953"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00954" /><CodeLine lineNumber="954"><Highlight kind="normal">    RangeChecksOut.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl/#a396fcfee6914c76974b73c3d203da6a5">emplace&#95;back</a>(CurrentChecks.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectortemplatecommon/#a58dc840fc84420b7f0b773794b8101c1">front</a>());</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00955" /><CodeLine lineNumber="955"><Highlight kind="normal">    RangeChecksOut.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl/#a396fcfee6914c76974b73c3d203da6a5">emplace&#95;back</a>(CurrentChecks.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectortemplatecommon/#acd9e771a3296c6b24146955754620557">back</a>());</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00956" /><CodeLine lineNumber="956"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00957" /><CodeLine lineNumber="957"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00958" /><CodeLine lineNumber="958"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(RangeChecksOut.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectortemplatecommon/#a1c479a8c434377c2b8cb056bdfdfc201">size</a>() &lt;= OldCount &amp;&amp; </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;We pessimized!&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00959" /><CodeLine lineNumber="959"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> RangeChecksOut.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectortemplatecommon/#a1c479a8c434377c2b8cb056bdfdfc201">size</a>() != OldCount;</Highlight></CodeLine>
